data.title: RSA Encryption/Decryption
data.solution:
key=input().replace("(","").replace(")","").split(",")
purpose=input()
message=input()
blockPosition=int(input())

n=int(key[0])
a=int(key[1])
x=int(message[(blockPosition-1)*2:blockPosition*2])

if purpose=="encrypt":
    print(f"The encrypted message is {(x**a%n)}.")
else:
    print(f"The decrypted message is {(x**a%n)}.")
data.statement:
The RSA encryption works by taking a message and encrypt according to the public key. On the other side, the RSA decryption works by taking an encrypted message and decrypting it according to the private key. 

Given a [[key]], output the encrypted/decrypted message. 

You are given a [[key]], which you need to understand if it is the public or the private key, as well as what the program [[purpose]]. You are also given the encrypted/decrypted [[message]]. You need to see which block of the message you want to encrypt/decrypt by receiving the position as [[blockPosition]]. 

Be aware each block contains a 2-digit integer from the original message. The position is a 1-based index. e.g. for the [[message]] {{1234567890}}, if [[blockPosition]]={{1}}, then [[xy]] is 12, if [[blockPosition]]={{2}}, then [[xy]] is 34, so on and so on.

Public Key: ([[n]],[[a]])
Encrypt given [[xy]] as the block in position [[blockPosition]]:
encrypted = mod(xy^a,n)

Private Key: ([[n]],[[b]])
Decrypt given [[xy]] as the block in position [[blockPosition]]:
decrypted = mod(xy^b,n)

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

The RSA encryption works by taking a message and encrypt according to the public key. On the other side, the RSA decryption works by taking an encrypted message and decrypting it according to the private key.

Given a key, output the encrypted/decrypted message.

You are given a key, which you need to understand if it is the public or the private key, as well as what the program purpose. You are also given the encrypted/decrypted message. You need to see which block of the message you want to encrypt/decrypt by receiving the position as blockPosition.

Be aware each block contains a 2-digit integer from the original message. The position is a 1-based index. e.g. for the message 1234567890, if blockPosition=1, then xy is 12, if blockPosition=2, then xy is 34, so on and so on.

Public Key: (n,a)
Encrypt given xy as the block in position blockPosition:
encrypted = mod(xy^a,n)

Private Key: (n,b)
Decrypt given xy as the block in position blockPosition:
decrypted = mod(xy^b,n)
Input
Line 1 key (public or private) as (n,a if public, b if private). n, a and b are all integers
Line 2 purpose that can either be encrypt or decrypt
Line 3 message as a string of integers
Line 4 block position as an integer
Output
Encrypted/Decrypted block in the format:

The [encrypted/decrypted] message is result.
Constraints
n,a,b,blockPosition>0
Number of blocks in message ≥ blockPosition
Example
Input
(1007,25)
encrypt
9972450881
1
Output
The encrypted message is 386.
